trans-unit.source: An abstract class that represents a single query request to [!INCLUDE[ssAstoria](~/add/includes/ssastoria-md.md)].
No public constructors are defined on this class.

Object instances are created by using <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.CreateQuery%2A> or <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext.CreateQuery%2A> on the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceContext> class.
Asynchronously sends a request to execute the data service query.
The returned <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object is used to determine when the asynchronous operation has completed.
For more information, see [Asynchronous Operations](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

The BeginExecute method uses the same semantics as the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery.Execute%2A> method, however BeginExecute asynchronously sends the request so that the call does not block processing while waiting for the results from the service.
According to the standard begin-end asynchronous pattern, the provided callback is invoked when query results are retrieved.
Delegate to invoke when results are available for client consumption.
User-defined state object passed to the callback.
An <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object that is used to track the status of the asynchronous operation.
Called to complete the asynchronous operation of executing a data service query.
The result from the <xref:System.Data.Services.Client.DataServiceQuery.BeginExecute*> operation that contains the query results.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> that contains the results of the query operation.
When the data service returns an HTTP 404: Resource Not Found error.
Executes the query against the data service.
The Execute method is used to execute the given data service query.
The Execute method generates an HTTP GET request that is set to the data service.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> that contains the results of the query operation.
When the data service returns an HTTP 404: Resource Not Found error.
Represents an expression that contains the query to the data service.
An <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.Expression> object that represents the query.
Represents the query provider instance.
An <xref:System.Linq.IQueryProvider> representing the data source provider.
Gets the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> object that can be used to iterate through the collection returned by the query.
Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
An enumerator over the query results.
